net.jxta.impl.endpoint.netty
Interface AddressTranslator

All Known Implementing Classes:
InetSocketAddressTranslator
public interface AddressTranslator

Describes a facility to convert between a SocketAddress and a JXTA EndpointAddress. Intended to allow flexibility in the Netty transport implementation, should we choose to use a transport which does not use traditional InetSocketAddresses for addressing.

Author:
iain.mcginniss@onedrum.com

Method Summary
 String getProtocolName()
          Provides the protocol name which is included in all translated EndpointAddresses.
 EndpointAddress toEndpointAddress(SocketAddress addr)
          Converts a SocketAddress fetched from a communication channel to the equivalent physical JXTA EndpointAddress.
 EndpointAddress toEndpointAddress(SocketAddress clientAddr, SocketAddress serverAddr)
          Converts a client socket address into an endpoint address, potentially overriding some properties of the client address with those of the server address (i.e. using the server's port rather than the transient client port).
 SocketAddress toSocketAddress(EndpointAddress addr)
          Converts a JXTA EndpointAddress into the equivalent physical SocketAddress.
 List<EndpointAddress> translateToExternalAddresses(SocketAddress bindpoint)
          Takes the provided local bound SocketAddress and returns 0 or more equivalent addresses which could be used to connect to that bound address externally.
 

Method Detail

toEndpointAddress

EndpointAddress toEndpointAddress(SocketAddress addr)
Converts a SocketAddress fetched from a communication channel to the equivalent physical JXTA EndpointAddress.

toSocketAddress

SocketAddress toSocketAddress(EndpointAddress addr)
Converts a JXTA EndpointAddress into the equivalent physical SocketAddress.

toEndpointAddress

EndpointAddress toEndpointAddress(SocketAddress clientAddr,
                                  SocketAddress serverAddr)
Converts a client socket address into an endpoint address, potentially overriding some properties of the client address with those of the server address (i.e. using the server's port rather than the transient client port).

translateToExternalAddresses

List<EndpointAddress> translateToExternalAddresses(SocketAddress bindpoint)
Takes the provided local bound SocketAddress and returns 0 or more equivalent addresses which could be used to connect to that bound address externally. Typically, this is to deal with the case where we have bound to the wildcard address (i.e. [::]:8080 or 0.0.0.0:8080) and wish to convert this into the physical IP addresses for the adapters on our machine (i.e. 192.168.1.45:8080, 172.16.0.52:8080, 10.1.1.12:8080, etc.)

getProtocolName

String getProtocolName()
Provides the protocol name which is included in all translated EndpointAddresses.
